job_title: Food Service Worker in Staten Island, NY
pros: I love working in the kitchen and having to make sure all the residence get the correct food.
cons: They listen to who they only feel needs help.

job_title: Occupational Therapist in Staten Island, NY
pros: Rehab staff is great and easy to work with
cons: The entire facility is short staffed, no recognition for the departments who do the work, no room for growth, numbers driven over employee satisfaction

job_title: Laundry Attendant in Staten Island, NY
pros: flexibility was a plus working here

review_title: New Management came in and cut union jobs. Brought in staff from other facility.
job_title: Accounts Receivable/Bookkeeper in Staten Island, NY
pros: Benefits, friendly workers, full lunch hour. Was able to work independently in an office setting as long as deadlines were met. One of the best Rehab Facilities on Staten Island. Kind and caring CNA's and Nursing Staff. Excellent Case Management team
cons: New Management. Incompetent workers in high positions. Favoritism by management lead to disgruntled workers that were there for many years. Full time jobs were cut to Part time jobs. Union jobs were eliminated. Office Drama.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Staten Island, NY
pros:
Great coworkers, well for the most part. 
You get into a great union (1199). This union is great.
cons:
You will never get time off when you request it. 
You will lose your benefit time because you never get the time off requested.
The union reps in this facility are  so tight with management that they never help you.

job_title: Charge Registered Nurse in Staten Island, NY
pros: Free lunches, management support break time, wonderful experience with upper management,  competitive pay, good hours and schedule, able to pick up extra time
cons: Being in management was difficult to discipline staff, no respect towards nurses and residents, lazy CNAs (I caught them sleeping in patient's rooms and eating their food)... disgusting
Bad working environment, little training, throw you to the wolves, unsupportive coworkers, toxic environment, overworked, glad I was able to get out when I could

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Staten Island, NY
pros: Local nursing home you actually feel like you're going to be helping seniors in need of care
cons: Administration only cares about their salaries and patting each other on the back not about the residents not about the employees that do all the hard work

job_title: Operations Engineer in New York, NY
pros: Very good staff and great facility
cons: Low staff size but they are great
